column1: Task
Accompany and supervise students during meals.
Accompany children to and from school, on outings, and to medical appointments.
Act as official escorts, such as when leading funeral processions or firefighters.
Attend to needs of athletic teams in clubhouses.
Care for children in institutional setting, such as group homes, nursery schools, private businesses, or schools for the handicapped.
Contact cemeteries to schedule the opening and closing of graves.
Coordinate conferences and meetings.
Deliver arrangements to customers, or oversee employees responsible for deliveries.
Discipline children and recommend or initiate other measures to control behavior, such as caring for own clothing and picking up toys and books.
Escort customers to their tables.
Escort small children across roads and highways.
Greet incoming guests and escort them to their rooms.
Hold regular meetings with each assigned unit.
Maintain close communications with dispatching personnel, using two-way radios or cell phones.
Maintain order among pupils during trips, in order to ensure safety.
Maintain regularly scheduled office hours in order to advise and assist students.
Manage the department and supervise clerical workers, directing and controlling activities of personnel in the medical records department.
Monitor animals recovering from surgery and notify veterinarians of any unusual changes or symptoms.
Monitor patients during treatment and report any unusual reactions to the respiratory therapist.
Monitor stations and games, and move dealers from game to game to ensure adequate staffing.
Observe and monitor children's play activities.
Organize and lead regular religious services.
Oversee day-to-day group activities of residents in institution.
Page guests in hotel lobbies, dining rooms, or other areas.
Plan routines, choose appropriate music, and choose different movements for each set of muscles, depending on participants' capabilities and limitations.
Plan, schedule, and coordinate funerals, burials, and cremations, arranging details such as floral delivery and the time and place of services.
Provide assistance to other health care personnel during dosimetry procedures and tumor localization.
Provide transportation and/or escort for expeditions such as shopping trips or visits to doctors or dentists.
Receive or usher people to their seats for services.
Schedule and maintain regular office hours to meet with students.
Supervise and coordinate activities of cooks and workers engaged in food preparation.
Supervise and coordinate activities of dining room staff to ensure that patrons receive prompt and courteous service.
Supervise and direct the work of correctional officers to ensure the safe custody, discipline, and welfare of inmates.
Teach classes or courses, and/or provide direct care to children.
